intro: Chaetospora aurea, commonly known as the golden spore moss, is a species of liverwort found in moist, shaded environments. It belongs to the family Porellaceae and is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth form. The plant has small, overlapping leaves that are typically green to yellowish in color. Its reproductive structures, called sorocarps, contain spores that are released into the air for dispersal. Chaetospora aurea plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its native ecosystems.
